Reviews.Title: “Like living in Pinterest!”
Reviews.Author: BAA1113
Reviews.Content: You could stay at Ackselhaus 10 times and never feel like you visited the same property! All the rooms are decorated so differently. I had room 14, I beachy, maritime suite with a huge couch, cute chandeliers, a freestanding tub, big comfy bed, huge TVs & awesome sound systems, mock fireplace... I mean, there were so many thoughtful details I don't even have time to list them all. I kept finding a new ship in a bottle or colorful pillow or decorative antique that made me think - wow, someone really put time & thought into designing this place. The only downside for me was that I didn't really know when checkout was or where breakfast was... but that was all easily remedied by asking the friendly front desk. One of the cutest hotels I've ever stayed at - will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent design & comfort at the blue home”
Reviews.Author: Kisutazo
Reviews.Content: We've stayed recently at the blue home and really enjoyed it. The suite we stayed in is above club del mar (which is the breakfast place for both ackselhaus and blue home). The design is cool: old and new together, the setup of the suite is practical. We even had a nice terrace. The location for this hotel is perfect to discover Prenzlauer Berg, but also the Mitte.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful neighborhood gem!”
Reviews.Author: Paula K
Reviews.Content: I will stay at Ackselhaus every trip to Berlin, it was home away from home and I didn't want to leave! The room was amazing - we stayed in apartment 14. The bathroom was huge with a wonderful clawfoot tub, double sink, and large walk in shower. The room was spacious, two desks and plenty of storage for our clothes.The room has a great stero with speakers in the main room and the bathroom, I also love that they had a Nespresso in the room! The staff was friendly and very accommodiating. If you need a taxi just call them and they will arrange in minutes! The neighborhood is fantastic, many wonderful resturants and shops (I would highly recommend Zander for dinner). Close to the U bahn station and the tram down the street takes you to Alexanderplatz, easy station to get anywhere in the city! Every Saturday they have a local market, not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: greatescape1020
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended - I was very pleased with this hotel from the prompt correspondence and ease of planning our stay to all the wonderful details and amenities offered. I agree with the other reviews that this hotel is in a great location - walking distance to many tourist sites and just a 15 minute walk away from the subway system, and a block from a cab stand; it's in an eclectic/culturally diverse community with plentiful restaurant options and varying ethnic cuisine. The nightlife, well, we never really found that... There are many places to have wine in dim romantic settings or plush couches that give the presentation that you are sitting in someone's home but, if you enjoy bands/live music, that for some reason we never found.

Reviews.Title: “Outperformed”
Reviews.Author: Joizee_HD
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews here and was a bit skeptical about how everyone was raving of this place. I take that all back. Had a wonderful stay. What a great find and I wish I had discovered it earlier. I had room 503 and couldn't of been happier. I can imagine that were it warmer, the lack of air conditioning may have been an issue being on the top floor but otherwise, everything was great. I really like the mix of older architecture with modern design. Plenty of space and a very comfortable bed too. Finally, a rain shower head which I love in hotel bathrooms. Everything was top-notch clean, staff were courteous and helpful, the hotel was easy to find and was conveniently located. I highly recommend this place if you need a hotel in Berlin which is neither an Econo-box or a chain. Lots of nice little touches to make it a home-away-from-home if you are in town for a couple days.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: davej007
Reviews.Content: Located in the Prenzlauer Berg section of Berlin this hotel was wonderful. Great service, excellent breakfast and the two bedroom apartment we had was perfect. The hotel is only a two block walk from the U-Bahn. You can bicycle or walk to the Alexanderplatz. Additionally, it is easy to reach from Tegel (20 minutes or so). Simply put, this is my headquarters when I am in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, courtyard, room, and neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: LucyAlmost
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this gorgeous hotel and beautiful, romantic courtyard! We stayed in the Burton Holmes room-- loved the decor and luxurious bathtub (w/ optional colored underwater lights?) in the room. We were so amazed by the lush, uncrowded, courtyard, that my boyfriend took the opportunity to propose there, so we're thrilled to have an excuse to return!

Reviews.Title: “Every detail perfectly executed”
Reviews.Author: urbanspelunker
Reviews.Content: Ackselhaus is a real treat, a unique place to stay where every detail has been carefully considered and comfort and relaxation is of the highest priority. We stayed in the Beach House room for 5 days, and did not want to leave. The bed was wonderfully comfortable, the sound system (in both bedroom and bathroom - for CDs, radio, or ipod) a real treat, the ambiance and decor imaginative, unique, and high class, the tub ABSOLUTELY indulgent, and the breakfast delicious. I can't wait to go back and stay in one of the other rooms because I have no doubt each is as carefully composed as ours was. Coming in the door at the end of the day felt like returning to a sanctuary and retreat all our own. There's an honor bar with snacks, drinks, etc., and a fridge and coffee and tea in the room. The neighborhood of Prenzlauerberg was a fantastic base from which to see Berlin, with unique shops and cafes throughout the area. Berlin is a large city and no matter where you stay you will likely need to use public transit to see what you want to see. We bought a week transit pass and used it each day to explore neighborhoods in east and west Berlin. The tram is right next to the hotel and the U2 subway, one of the main lines, is a few blocks away, and there is never more than a few minutes' wait for public transit. Very well worth the money, even with the horrible USD-Euro exchange rate. Nicer than most 5-star hotels I've stayed in because of the unique design and ambiance. It's a real gem.

Reviews.Title: “At Home in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Ralff
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable "apartment like" stay in Berlin. Two blocks to great restaurants and bars in Kolwitzplatz area. U-bahn 10 minute walk and trams within a two block walk. Quiet residential area one block to the Wasserturm. Very attractive entryway and courtyard. Breakfast whilst watching the three saltwater fish tanks.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay in Berlin if you don't like the hotel atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: EuDiMu
Reviews.Content: Ackselhaus is a nice hotel in Preunlauerberg. We chose this hotel cause looked very pretty on the picture and because of the area..still city center, nice and quiet, convenitently located to all the rest of the city thanks to the U Bahn. What Ackselhaun mostly features is a one of a kind structure that doesn't give it the proper feeling of a hotel but more like apartments. So if you don't like the "hotel" life it is the perfect place. You enter in a lobby (non operation 24h but they were so nice to wait our arrival by 23.30) and then you get into a beautiful garden that brings you to some rooms on garden floor and then up with the elevator to other rooms. It is very quiet and perfect if you want relax. It is conveniently located 5 min walk from the U Bahn (senefelder strasse) and if you like something to eat or drink, very closeby there is kastanienallee full of pubs, fast food, cozy restaurant and typical nice stores. We decided not to have breakfast included cause the price of 25 euro per person looked too much. But don't worry: walking through Kollowitzstrasse you'll find a lot of cafes. If i may suggest Anna Blume is one of the most delicious. Also another good place right close to the U bahn stop (senefelder strasse) is LPG Biomarkt. it is a biological supermarket that has also a cafeteria where prepare coffee and pastries. it is a cheap and fast solution.. Talking about the rooms, i admit they're stunning. We stayed in the one called honeymoon. It is more an apatment than a room.. There was a kitchen, a bathroom, a big bedroom and a second room with a comfortable sofa and a drawer. the theme of the apartment was the honeymoon so it was fully of romantic details: from the curtains to seclude the bed area by the rets of the room, to the lamps, the flower theme wallpaper. I must admit it was one of the best stays ever in a romantic ambiance, cosy and full of atmosphere... perfect for a romantic getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Very charming but a few issues.....”
Reviews.Author: dk-trips
Reviews.Content: This is a very charming hotel in a lovely area.As we stayed here in October I can not tell anything about the small garden as it was not possible to use it because of the weather. We had an apartment no 301.At first sight very nice but we did had a few issues. The toilet was very "smelly" and I mean not in a nice way.The telephone in the room was not working and freeze was not clean.We did pay 260 € for the apartment so I think it should have been better!A good thing about the hotel were the lovely breakfast and the very CHARMING area the hotel is placed in:-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JECan
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Ackselhaus and it is in an excellent location. It is located in a great area which is fast becoming a sought after neighborhood in what was East Berlin. The area is trendy with lots of great restaurants. First, there is no air condition and it was about 35 degrees when we were in Berlin so it was very uncomfortable. The Blue House (the sister hotel) was full and from what I gather this is a better choice. Our room was actually very large with a kitchen and sitting area. The bathroom is clean with a shower, toilet, and sink. Nothing too special. During the weekend, our room was very quiet but as soon as Monday arrived the noise was terrible starting at about 4am with the delivery truck arriving at the corner store. This was the Venice room I think they called it (facing the street). Breakfast is included and it was excellent. Lots of choice with fresh jams, breads and an assortment of cereals, eggs and pretty much whatever you wanted. The service was very friendly. The value is good and I think we would consider staying here another time but we would definitely want to choose another room. Proximity to the train and buses is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent service, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: abe555
Reviews.Content: I have to say I feel extremely lucky to have found the Ackselhaus/Blue Home. It was in a perfect location, central to most sites, and the neighborhood itself was chock-full of great restaurants and shops and beautiful parks. The breakfasts served at the Cafe Del Mar, attached to the Blue Home, were fantastic. We went to bed every night anticipating breakfast the next morning. Fresh pastries, breads, cheeses, meats, everything you could hope for and more. We stayed in one of the apartments in the Blue Home and it was better than we expected. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody visiting Berlin. The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful. I will be staying at Ackselhaus/Blue Home every time I visit Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dinosaurnothing
Reviews.Content: I've let 2 month slip by before posting this so details are sparse. However I just wanted to post that we really enjoyed our stay here. We were in the Studio Deluxe in the BlueHome hotel for a weekend during the Berlin Film Festival. The staff were spot on in terms of being helpful but not overbearing. They spoke great English but also were patient with me while I tried my GCSE level German. The room was beautiful with a uniqueness/special feel to it and area was great for getting around. We would definately recommend and go back.

Reviews.Title: “confortable, cosy and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: edved0
Reviews.Content: We couldn't find a room, so we had an accomodation in the apartment, which are i guess a little less stilish, but still very warm (maybe more) and well kept. the position is excellent (prenzauer berg) and the tenders are kind. everything for 140 € per night including brreakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Stylish Boutique Hotel - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ThirtyByThirty
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. It's in a great neighborhood, exudes tons of character and has stylish decor. We were in the "ROM" room and loved it. I would stay here again when I return to Berlin. While it isn't the most luxurious hotel I've ever stayed at, it is certainly comfortable and an outstandingly great value and that means there is more money for shopping at the fabulous stores nearby.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was stunning!”
Reviews.Author: TandD26
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay. Can only speak in glowing terms about the studio apartment we had in the Blue House, quiet and very comfortable bed. Breakfast was excellent, staff friendly and helpful, wifi in room, free laundry service gave us additional sight seeing time. We would happily stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “lovely area, but stay in bluehome”
Reviews.Author: kmj441
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay at ackselhaus today. neighbourhood was fab with great cafes and resturants literally on the door step. hotel was interesting, but I would definatley stay in the bluehome if I was returning again. We stayed in an apartment on the third floor in the ackselhaus and to be honest it was a little tired looking and a little musty smelling. The bathroom or should I say shower room was ok but the wallpaper was starting to peel of the walls and the shower was very tempremental - either boiling hot then cool the next minute. On a positive note the service was great and the breakfast was lovely. My tip would be - pay a little extra and stay in the bluehome.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous Hotel in Top Location”
Reviews.Author: l-globetrotter
Reviews.Content: Having been to Berlin a few times, and having experienced Ackselhaus and Prinzlauer Berg area where it is lcoated, I would not contemplate staying anywhere else. Firstly, the area itself is THE place to be, not because it is trendy, relaxed, bohemian, arty, live music streaming most places, alternative, classy, relaxed, organic haven - yes it is all those things, but more so because it has such an amazing ambience. One can spend literally days just in Prinzlauer Berg and surrounds. Get hotel to book you into Pasternak for a dinner or wonder a little furthe afield for fab Japanese at Sasaya's, that is before you hit Cafe de Paris with their fantastic desserts and fresh mint leaf tea etc. If you are after relaxing weekend rather than "snap and move" touristy experience, then this place is a must. Pre and post booking service was great. We were offered a last minute cancellation on a 2bdr apartment at the same price as the double room(s) we were after that were booked out. We have "Venice" apartment, no photos on web, may not be as sophisticated as Rome or studio deluxe but it is nice enough and is in Ackselhaus. Blue House which is two doors down and in the same building as lovely breakfast location of Cafe del Mar, is also fab and part of the hotel. Fish tanks inserted into the walls, lovely buffet breakfast, with fresh bread for you to pick put in your cane basket and take outside to sit in the sun, blanckets cushions and cane chairs, with great attentive service. The highlight, particularly on a sunny May long weekend, has to be the lovely gardens that both Ackselhaus and Blue Home offer their guests. It is a tranquil paradise, and the photos on the hotel's website are a true reflection of reality. We bought beautiful fresh produce at Kollwilplatz open air markets on Saturday (a must experience) and had an alfresco long lunch with friends who dropped in to see us. Staff were most attentive to give us extra wine glasses and to ensure we were taken care of. If you are after touristy trip, dont worry, we walked to Alexanderplatz no probs, but you can catch a tram that is 50m from the hotel, 3 stops and you are there. From there you can walk to the Museum Island or Branderburg gate, or catch 100, 200 ot TXL bus wherever you want to go. If you dive, like we did, free parking right in front of the hotel, very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: smk007
Reviews.Content: Great location in Penzlauerberg, only a couple of blocks from the U Bahn station (U2 line, bringing you straight into Stadtmitte and on to Wittenbergerplatz, by the KaDaWe department store). We stayed in the Rome room which was enormous, nicely decorated and very warm. The room shared a small hallway with another room, the bathroom and kitchenette belonging to our room were off this hall (both lockable with the room key). Only the two rooms has access to this small hallway. Breakfast was in the Club del Mar, a couple of doors down, and was lovely - buffet breakfast but with waiter service to make proper coffee etc. Prenzlauerberg is a good place to stay with lots of bars, cafes (Anita Wronski on Knaakstr was good) and restaurants (Gugelhupf, Due Forni) within walking distance. There was a small organic market on Kollwitzplz on Thursday morning - you have got to try the Bratwurst with the 8 different mustard options and the vegetable waffles (sound terrible but really light and fluffy). The market is bigger on Saturdays, I think.

Reviews.Title: “Choose the "blue home"”
Reviews.Author: otreinen
Reviews.Content: For our first visit to Berlin, we chose the hotel Ackslehaus because of its location in Prenzlauer Berg, the SoHo of Berlin as we were told. And we were not disappointed: this is the place where Berlin proves to be to Germany what New York is to the USA – Berlin is not Germany, it’s a universe of its own. Rather than a hotel, the Ackselhaus is a perfectly renovated house of the end of the 19th century converted into an appartment building, conveniently located at 10’ walk from the subway Senefelder Platz. Unfortunately, there is no elevator, which meant for us 5 floors to climb – with luggage, and without assistance, as service is reduced to a quite fromal reception and check in. The room is large, with a small kitchen and a refrigerator, a luxury to which we would have preferred a more thorough cleaning: even after complaining about hair on the bathroom floor, no improvement occurred. Breakfast is perfect and plenty, in the Club del Mar located just 20m away from the Ackselhaus in the sister house “blue home”, which is more expensive as a hotel, but cosier and equipped with an elevator. Do not hesitate to have some typical Berlin food at the restaurant located just next to the blue home, which, for some obscur reasons, the receptionist was not willing to recommend nor even to comment to us. Another point is that they do not accept credit cards – hard to imagine, and I hope they will adpat to the real world soon. In short, Ackselhaus is nice, a bit chilly, and slightly overpriced considering the exceptional offers in other parts of Berlin. If you want to stay at Prenzlauer Berg, which we can strongly recommend, invest even a little more and stay at the blue home.

Reviews.Title: “Prenzlauer Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Spoorty
Reviews.Content: I found this little gem (Blue Home) in the Lonely Planet guide and I must say I was not dissapointed. I booked via a phone call from Australia and the staff were extremely friendly. Made my booking not knowing what to expect when i arrived for my first visit to Berlin. When I arrived it was afternoon and I was tired from over 35+ hours of travelling on planes,trains & taxi's. The staff recommended a short walk of the area. Nothing was a problem for the relaxed and friendly staff, it felt like you were part of their home. Prenzlauerberg was a really lovely place and the Blue Home was such a cool place to come back to at the end of a long day sightseeing Berlin. Close to some great cafe/resturant streets, Great litle pub downstairs for that late afternoon beer. It was wonderful to walk around the quite streets in the twighlight. Beautifully furnished apartment and great value for money, I would recommend the Blue home to any business or holiday traveller. Close to the U-Bahn, and easy to find, great if you just want to chill fo a few days. I'll be certainly coming back to Berlin, Prenzlauer & Ackselhaus/Blue Home.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem in the heart of Prenz'lberg!”
Reviews.Author: foodissima
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel's Blue Home, with my 2 teenage daughters, and we really loved its relaxed, comfortable feel. We had a mini-apartment with a fully-functioning contemporary small kitchen (the eating out is so good in Berlin though that we didn't make the best use of it!) The breakfast is fabulous, and hearty enough to get you through till teatime, the rooms were comfy and spacious, (I slept on an extremely comfortable sofa-bed, and the girls had the stylish bedroom) we had a balcony and the garden is gorgeous. The hotel kindly and efficiently organised bikes for us to explore the (cyclist-friendly! woo hoo!) city (if only to let us confirm that PrenzlauerBerg is absolutely the most appealing corner of this amazing chilled-out friendly city - the hotel is excellently located in the heart of it in a lovely quiet tree-lined street, near everything, buzzy but relaxed, too.) The reception staff were amazingly helpful and friendly, and we were all very impressed all round. Highly recommended. (Even in the rain we loved the place, can't wait to return in the sunshine!). The only drawback was the rather tedious and ubiquitous muzak, which was a bit irritating. (Hotel, a small NB- we don't all love Celine Dion! Peace and quiet is infinitely preferable and it would have been nice to have this option) But I would definitely go back there, despite this quibble.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Choice”
Reviews.Author: tallminty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two nights, we were delighted to be in the Honeymoon Suite. It is a fifth floor walk-up (no problem since we live on the fourth floor at home), but might be a challenge for those with a ton of luggage. The room consisted of a beautiful sitting room with a huge window, a comfy bedroom with more windows, and a large kitchen. Although we didn't get to cook, we did make use of the electric kettle. It was very relaxing and on a rainy day, hard to leave. There are several gardens and courtyards to extend the cozy feeling. The staff was very courteous, but the breakfast, while good, was a bit expensive at 15 Euros each, there are plenty of other options in this amazing neighborhood. I will definitely return and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “A special place”
Reviews.Author: jobhh
Reviews.Content: The Ackselhaus and the connected Blue Home are an excellent choice in the Prenzlauer Berg district of Berlin. More an apartment house than a hotel, this property is great for extended stays. I stayed only for one night, unfortunately, in a top-floor deluxe studio of the Blue Home. The studio was rather large, nice furniture, and a great view of the TV tower. The only minuses were the pretty small bathroom and the very squeaky bedframe (which could deprive couples of their sleep). The breakfast in the morning was very tasty with a good variety of rolls, bread, cold cuts, cheese, cereal, fresh fruit, and boiled eggs, served by a cheerful young Australian lady. The Ackselhaus is a great base for exploring the East side of Berlin, providing a homey atmosphere and not an anonymous hotel experience that you would find elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nitina
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here in June 2007 for a week and we loved it. We stayed in of the apartments in the main hotel (Ackelhaus) and it was very spacious and very nicely decorated. The neighborhood around is very pretty and it's also quiet, no street noise. We found the staff to be very friendly and although we chose not to pay for breakfast, there is a small supermarket just on the corner called 'Netto' and we bought breakfast for the whole week. Food in Berlin is so cheap. The location is excellent. It is very close to the city centre and all the sights. There is a tram stop 1 min walk from the hotel that takes you straight to Alexanderplatz and takes about 5 mins. From there you can take any metro to go to different parts of Berlin. Also there is a metro stop near the hotel that takes about 10 mins walk. The location makes it very convenient for transport. The neighborhood of Prenzlauer Berg in East Berlin is so nice! There are many nice cafes, restaurants etc and it's not touristy either. The architecture was very pretty and interesting, we found it nicer than other parts of Berlin. I would highly recommend staying in East Berlin as your base when you visit, the west is more commercialised and the buildings look like any other European city. If I go back to Berlin I will definitely stay in this area again and in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: zagat
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Blue Home, in a wonderful room overlooking the street. I loved the room, I loved the hotel, I loved the neighborhood. It's close to everything you need in P'berg, including tram and trains.... and tucked away on a side street away from the bustle. Breakfast downstairs every morning was simple and perfect, and the decor of the hotel makes it unique and special. I will stay here again when next in Berlin. I've also stayed at the Hotel Hackescher Markt in Mitte but I prefer this charming hotel and neighborhood much more.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a place in a gem of a place”
Reviews.Author: CintiKid
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Prezlauer Berg searching for a Flat for a week and were extremely pleased with Hotal ackselhouse. The room was spacious with intelligently placed and lovely and functional furnishings. Wonderful breakfast brunch only 10 euros each, Very friendly and helpful personel. OK, the sidewalks are a bit uneven and the privacy in the bathroom was so-so, as was bathroom lighting. But tub was big; bed was big and easy to sleep in and delightfully canopied. On cold days the room was nicely warm (in March). half a block away is another gem, Luso - a Portugese restaurant with very fine and friendly service and most tasty grilled fresh fish, and green wine. Transportation close at hand. Wonderful stay at reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “A choice of lack of light or lack of privacy!”
Reviews.Author: chrisdf
Reviews.Content: I was happy to get to know Princelauerberg a bit. I had not visited this part of Berlin before. However the flat in which I stayed which was well furnished and decorated got too little daylight to the main sleeping and living area. Opening a blind which kept light out, one realized that this room was on the same level as and directly next to a roof area, hence the shut heavy blind. On one occasion, there was a person looking directly from the roof area into my main room (lack of privacy, if blind not shut keeping light out). Stairs led up from the main courtyard to the roof area where sheets were hung later. Seeing me in my room, an embarrassed person seemed to scuttle away back down from whence he had come, the stairs from the communal courtyard area. Also, the advertised wireless-LAN acessibility anywhere in the ackselhouse seemed not operate at the desk of my flat (Reception confirmed that in one flat wireless-LAN did not work; I had to go into the communal courtyard in the dark). Perhaps what I got was a flat cheap at 95 Euros a night (without breakfast). When I booked over the telephone asking for a room for one person, I should have checked better what I was getting. And if I had been told that I was not getting a single room or a double room at single rate but a flat cheap because it had no wireless-LAN access and lack of light or privacy, I would not have stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the apartments last year and thought they were great. It was really handy having the kitchen. We went back this year for my 30th birthday and stayed in the 'hotel rooms'. The bathroom was amazing, it had the biggest bath I'd ever seen and the beds are so comfortable. I cannot recommend this hotel enough!

Reviews.Title: “Ackselhaus is lovely”
Reviews.Author: Natsw
Reviews.Content: Ackselhaus is a really nice place to stay. Rather than rooms it has lots of little apartments - which would be great for families - where you have your own kitchen and often a sitting room too. You can have breakfast there but we never did as there are loads of little cafes nearby that do fantastic breakfast and/or brunch. The area is lovely - in my opinion the best bit of Berlin - where you can get a lovely feel for the atmosphere of the city. I have stayed here a number of times and wouldn't hesitate to return

HotelInfo.Name: Ackselhaus
HotelInfo.Address: Belforter Str. 21, 10405 Berlin, Germany
